sentences.sentence: Snow White

Once upon a time in the middle of winter, when the flakes of snow( 雪花 ) were falling like feathers( 羽毛 ) from the sky, a queen sat at a window sewing( 做针线活 ), and the frame( 框 ) of the window was made of black ebony( 乌木 ).
And while she was sewing and looking out of the window at the snow, she pricked( 扎 ) her finger with the needle( 针 ), and three drops of blood fell upon the snow.

And the red looked pretty upon the white snow, and she thought to herself, “I wish that I had a child with skin as white as snow, lips( 嘴唇 ) as red as blood, and hair as black as the wood of the window frame( 框 ).”
Soon after that she had a little daughter, whose skin was as white as snow, and lips as red as blood, and her hair was as black as ebony;
and she was therefore called Snow White.
And when the child was born, the Queen died.
After a year had passed, the King married another wife.
She was a beautiful woman, but proud, and she could not bear to think that anyone else could be more beautiful than her.
She had a magic mirror( 镜子 ), and when she stood in front of it and looked at herself in it, and said:
“Mirror, mirror, on the wall,
Who is the fairest( 最漂亮的 ) of us all?”
Then the mirror would always answer:
“You, Oh Queen, are the fairest of them all!”
Then she was satisfied, for she knew that the mirror spoke the truth.
But Snow White was growing up, and grew more and more beautiful—more beautiful than the Queen herself.
And once when the Queen asked her mirror:
“Mirror, mirror, on the wall,
Who is the fairest of us all?”
It answered:
“Queen, you are fair, that’s very true,
But Snow White is fairer still than you.”
Then the Queen was shocked( 震惊的 ), and turned green with envy( 嫉妒 ).
And from that hour her heart turned against Snow White, and she hated her.
And envy and pride grew in her heart like weeds( 杂草 ), so that she had no peace day or night.
She called a huntsman( 猎人 ), and said, “Take the child away into the forest; I will no longer have her in my sight. Kill her, and bring me back her heart as proof( 证据 ).”
The huntsman obeyed( 遵循 ), and took her away.
But when he had drawn his knife, and was about to pierce( 刺穿 ) Snow White’s innocent( 无辜的 ) heart, she began to weep( 哭泣 ), and said,
“Ah dear huntsman, leave me my life! I will go away into the wild wood, and never come home again.”
And as she was so beautiful, the huntsman had pity on her and said, “Run away, then, you poor child.”
“The wild beasts( 野兽 ) will soon eat you, anyway,” he thought, and yet it seemed as if a stone had been rolled( 被滚动 ) from off his heart since he decided to spare her life.
And as a young boar( 野猪 ) just then came running by he killed it with his spear( 矛 ), and cut out its heart and took it to the Queen as proof that the child was dead.
The cook had to prepare this, and the wicked( 恶毒的 ) Queen ate it, and thought she had eaten the heart of Snow White.
But now the poor child was all alone in the great forest, and was terrified( 害怕的 ) of every leaf of every tree, and did not know what to do.
Then she began to run, and ran over sharp( 尖利的 ) stones and through thorns( 荆棘 ), and the wild beasts chased( 追赶 ) after her, but did her no harm.
She ran as far as her feet would go until it was almost evening; then she saw a little cottage( 小屋 ) and went into it to rest herself.
Everything in the cottage was small, but very neat( 整洁的 ) and clean.
There was a table on which was a white cloth( 布 ), and seven little plates( 盘子 ), and on each plate a little spoon.
There were seven little knives and forks, and seven little glasses.
Against the wall stood seven little beds side by side, covered with clean white sheets( 床单 ).
Little Snow White was so hungry and thirsty that she ate some porridge( 麦片粥 ) and bread from each plate and drank a drop of wine out of each glass, for she did not wish to take all from one only.
Then, as she was so tired, she laid herself down on one of the little beds, but none of them suited( 适合 ) her.
One was too long, another too short. But at last she found that the seventh one was right, and so she remained in it, said a prayer( 祷辞 ), and went to sleep.

article_info.previous: Rapunzel一出生就被女巫带走了，女巫把Rapunzel关在一个没有门的塔楼里，不让她和任何人接触。一天，一个王子穿过森林的时候听到了甜美的歌声从塔楼里传来，王子沉醉于这美妙的歌声不可自拔，终于找到机会与Rapunzel相见，两人相知相许，却被女巫棒打鸳鸯。王子和Rapunzel历尽艰辛，终成眷属。读完了“莴苣姑娘”，今天我们将走进“白雪公主”的世界。
article_info.share_words: I wish that I had a child with skin as white as snow, lips as red as blood, and hair as black as the wood of the window frame.

question.cn: 下列关于“白雪公主”的说法中，哪一项是正确的？
question.en: Which of the following statements was true about Snow White?

options.cn: 她的皮肤像乌木一样黑。
options.en: Her skin was as black as ebony.

options.cn: 她的母亲在她出生后就去世了。
options.en: Her mother died after she was born.

analysis: 文中提到：“And when the child was born, the Queen died.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 恶毒的王后要求猎人做什么？
question.en: What did the wicked Queen ask the huntsman to do?

options.cn: 她要求猎人把“白雪公主”丢弃在森林里。
options.en: She asked the huntsman to abandon “Snow White” in the forest.

options.cn: 她要求猎人杀掉“白雪公主”并把白雪公主的心脏带回来。
options.en: She asked the huntsman to kill “Snow White” and bring her Snow White’s heart.

options.cn: 她要求猎人把“白雪公主”关在监狱里。
options.en: She asked the huntsman to put “Snow White” in prison.

analysis: 文中提到：“She called a huntsman, and said, ‘Take the child away into the forest; I will no longer have her in my sight. Kill her, and bring me back her heart as proof.’”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 为什么“白雪公主”吃了不同盘子里的东西呢？
question.en: Why did “Snow White” eat food from different plates?

options.cn: 因为她想尝尝不同盘子里的食物的味道。
options.en: Because she wanted to have a taste of each plate.

options.cn: 因为她不想把一个盘子里的东西吃光。
options.en: Because she did not wish to take all from one only.

analysis: 文中提到：“Little Snow White was so hungry and thirsty that she ate some porridge and bread from each plate and drank a drop of wine out of each glass, for she did not wish to take all from one only.”因此答案选C。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第72天
